t: The*pn wilderness and the desert will be glad, And*ln the Arabah will rejoice and blossom; Like*ln the crocus

It*ln will blossom profusely And*ln rejoice with rejoicing and shout of joy. The*ln glory of Lebanon will be given to it, The*ln majesty of Carmel and Sharon. They*ln will see the glory of the Lord,*s The*ln majesty of our God.
Encourage*ln the exhausted, and strengthen the feeble.
Say*ln to those with anxious heart, “Take*ln courage, fear not. Behold,*ln your God will come with*i vengeance; The*ln recompense of God will come, But*ln He will save you.”
Then*ln the eyes of the blind will be opened And*ln the ears of the deaf will be unstopped.
Then*ln the lame will leap like a deer, And*ln the tongue of the mute will shout for joy. For*ln waters will break forth in the wilderness And*ln streams in the Arabah.
The*ln scorched land will become a pool And*ln the thirsty ground springs of water; In*ln the haunt of jackals, its resting place, Grass*ln becomes*i reeds and rushes.

A*ln highway will be there, a roadway, And*ln it will be called the Highway of Holiness. The*ln unclean will not travel on it, But*ln it will*i be for him who walks that*i way, And*ln fools will not wander on*i it.*i
No*ln lion will be there, Nor*ln will any vicious beast go up on it; These*ln will not be found there. But*ln the redeemed will walk there,*i

And*ln the ransomed of the Lord*s will return And*ln come with joyful shouting to Zion, With*ln everlasting joy upon their heads. They*ln will find gladness and joy, And*ln sorrow and sighing will flee away.
